article.title: Scenario of the Birth of Hidden Attractors in the Chua Circuit

multiple_choice_question.text: What do the red lines in Figure 1(a) represent?
choices: Bifurcation curves of the symmetric equilibrium stability
Bifurcation curves of the zero equilibrium stability
Areas of existence of the symmetric equilibria
Domains corresponding to the existence of only one equilibrium

multiple_choice_question.text: In Figure 1(b), what color represents the real part of the complex conjugate eigenvalues?
What type of voltage-current characteristic is depicted in Figure 1(d)?
What color in Figure 2 represents the chaotic dynamics of the Chua system?
What do the areas filled by white color in Figure 2 represent?
In Figure 3(a), what color represents the two symmetric self-excited Chua attractors?
What do the orange dots in Figure 3(b) represent?
In Figure 4(a) and (b), what does the bifurcation line for m<sub>0</sub> ≈ −0.1761  represent?
choices: Loss of stability of the zero equilibrium
Transition from a limit cycle to a chaotic attractor

multiple_choice_question.text: What type of bifurcation is depicted in the bifurcation diagram in Figure 4(c)?
What color in Figure 5 represents the areas of attraction of the stable zero equilibrium?
In Figure 5(b), what does the thick line separating the basin of attraction of the stable limit cycle and the area of divergency represent?
choices: Stable manifold of the symmetric equilibrium point
Unstable manifold of the symmetric equilibrium point
